posts.body: Don't you just love filler content? It's really quite amazing.
posts.title: More Filler

posts.body:
I really shouldn't be messing with this right now...

I have exams...
posts.title: Studying

posts.body:
- [x] Rewrite marked-element to use showdownjs, create as a [new project](https://github.com/zacharyrs/showdown-element).

- [x] Create custom syntax highlighting - base16-ashes

- [ ] Write Showdown extension to 'polymerize'. It will convert checkboxes to `paper-checkbox`.

- [x] Change posts to use timestamps

- [ ] Redesign single post view

- [x] Make datebox a link too

- [ ] Fix FAB, swap to width and use vars (rewrite?)

- [x] Set up posts limits (eg load 20 at a time)

- [ ] Set up caching database/content, and service worker

- [ ] Configure algolia with indexing for title/keywords
posts.title: Todo

posts.body:
```ruby
require 'gem'

string = 'base16'
symbol = :base16
fixnum = 0
float  = 0.00
array  = Array.new
array  = ['chris', 85]
hash   = {'test' => 'test'}
regexp = /[abc]/

# This is a comment
class Person

  attr_accessor :name

  def initialize(attributes = {})
    @name = attributes[:name]
  end

  def self.greet
    'hello'
  end
end

person1 = Person.new(:name => 'Chris')
print Person::greet, ' ', person1.name, '\n'
puts 'another #{Person::greet} #{person1.name}'
```
